chunks.en:
# February LPR Released
According to the official website of the People's Bank of China, the one-year loan prime rate (LPR) for February 2024 is 3.45%, the same as last month; the LPR for over 5 years is 3.95%, down from 4.2% last month.
# What are the subsequent impacts and current situation?
How do V friends view this?
The rate cut is too slow, and the intensity is still insufficient. It should obviously be in the ICU, but it's still wandering around in the outpatient clinic.
@nikola11 ğŸ˜…Impossible
It didn't drop before the Spring Festival. Now the adjustment is only effective for new houses. The stock has to wait another year. It's not satisfying even though it's been cut.
@Troevil No, I chose the loan date to reduce the interest rate https://springwood.me/china-house-loan-rate-down/
1. Pressure is put on the housing provident fund interest rate. 2. Deposit interest rates are going to be lowered again.
It will be cut several more times this year, possibly within 3.
I just finished converting a commercial loan to a public fund loan, so if I don't apply, it won't be lowered, right...
@Vvictor If the rate is not lowered quickly, everything will collapse together.
100 loan, saved 50,000 in 30 years, keep it up.
If you don't buy, I don't buy, the rate can still be lowered.
@Troevil #8 Isn't it implemented after one year from your loan date?

@Troevil Not everyone is January 1st, many are the month the loan is issued, like me in May. My consistent view is: the state is desperately trying to save real estate, whether it can be saved or not, I don't know.
@belin520 But most people are January 1st

chunks.en: Predicting, 3.7 in May, 3.45 in October, and no more reductions before at least 2026.
@naminokoe Most can't choose and are January 1st
My loan is repriced every month, and I can enjoy the new interest rate next month.
@Troevil #15 Most are the loan disbursement date now. I looked at the repayment plan and it happened to be on the 21st, and the repayment amount is already less.
@R18 Share which bank
@EchoWhale Industrial Bank
It's been deflationary for several months, and it's still at 3.95.
